definition: to face/to overlook/to arrive/to be (just) about to/just before

sentences.english: More than a third of the workforce is now part-time or temporary employees.
sentences.chinese: 現在超過三分之一的工人成爲兼職工或者臨時工。

sentences.english: Gurria says temporary labor migration dropped 17 percent in 2009.
sentences.chinese: 古里亞說，2009年臨時工移民下降了17%。

sentences.english: As a day laborer, he had no health or disability insurance.
sentences.chinese: 身爲臨時工的王明志沒有醫療或工傷保險。

sentences.english: Census employment may make it more difficult for companies to find part-time help, he said.
sentences.chinese: 人口普查往往能夠使得企業更難找到臨時工。

sentences.english: His wife is temporary canteens , only two or three hundred dollars a month.
sentences.chinese: 妻子是食堂臨時工，每月只有兩三百元。

sentences.english: The male members do odd-work such as rag picking and scrap dealing.
sentences.chinese: 家庭男性成員做像拾荒這樣的臨時工。

sentences.english: Irregulars also get far less on-the-job training than their contracted counterparts.
sentences.chinese: 而且臨時工參加在職培訓的機會也比正式員工少得多。

sentences.english: Using temporary workers can eliminate these as well as the direct costs of employing someone.
sentences.chinese: 使用臨時工，可以免除此類費用和僱人的直接成本。

sentences.english: The boss wants to meet with all the temps this afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 老闆想在今天下午跟所有的臨時工見面。

sentences.english: They are squeezing more productivity out of fewer employees, adding overtime hours or temporary workers.
sentences.chinese: 這些公司極力減員增效，延長工作時間或增加臨時工。

sentences.english: Gibson went with the flow, and before long, a temporary job turned to a full-time one in the auto-parts plant.
sentences.chinese: 不久，由一個汽車零件廠的臨時工變成全日工。

sentences.english: It hired Samuel as a temporary worker to do the job.
sentences.chinese: 它僱傭了塞彌兒作爲臨時工來做這事。

sentences.english: The draft law stipulates that employers must pay local minimum wages to part-time employees.
sentences.chinese: 該草案規定僱傭方必須付給臨時工當地的最低工資。

sentences.english: Now they live in temporary "benders" – shelters made from branches covered with plastic sheeting.
sentences.chinese: 現在，他們住在用樹枝和塑料薄膜搭建的臨時工棚裏。

definition: to be transferred to another post/to post away
student who also works part-time/(old) reform-school student
to eliminate/to sack/to remove from office
abbr. for 國家安全局|国家安全局[Guo2 jia1 An1 quan2 ju2]
to hog/to keep everything for oneself
to support one's family (idiom); to have difficulty feeding a family
to deal with/to wait on/to provide for
